overview:
Evan Liang is responsible for evaluating investment opportunities and supporting portfolio companies.

Prior to joining Shasta Ventures, Evan worked in product management at eBay, where he developed new features to improve the buyer experience on the core marketplace platform. Prior to eBay, Evan worked in business development at Microsoft where he helped launch the Xbox 360. Evan has also served as a strategy consultant to Smart Modular advising the CEO and board during the company’s spin out from Solectron in 2004. In addition to his operational experience, Evan has 4 years of venture experience as an analyst and associate at Battery Ventures where he focused on the software and e-commerce sectors. Education:

* M.B.A, Kellogg School of Management
* B.S., Industrial Engineering, Stanford University
